text: 500 ml bottle, from the brewery. ABV is 8%. Dark reddish brown colour, moderate off-white to beige head. Nice aroma of malts, brown bread, caramel and bakery. Fairly sweet flavour, notes of caramel, molasses, slightly roast malts, moderate hops. Good beer.

En bouteille au MBM. Couleur ambrée foncé, rubis. Arômes de toast, sucre dorge. Sucre dorge, toast, caramel. Palais bien rond. Bon produit mais rien dexceptionnel par rapport à ce qui se fait au Québec.
KRS 070117. Dark brown color with a beige head. Aroma is fruit, roasted malt, caramel, alcohol. flavor is fruit, roasted malt, caramel, alcohol, dried fruits, bread. Decent beer.
Bottled. Deep ambery brown colour, mediumsized head. Aroma is sweet malts, some alcohol, fudge and some toasted toffee. Flavour is sweet malts, alcohol, toasted and some fudge and mild ripe fruits

Bottled 500ml (Vinmonopolet Kirkenes)
Dark copper color, small steady beige head and some lace. Sweetish with toasted bready maltyness. Medium-bodied. Caramel, riped fruits, sweetness. Some alcohol, even warming. Balanced sweetish malty bock.

50cl bottle. Norski tasting, Vaasa. 
The beer pours dark brown with a thin brown head. 
Sweet bready malty brew. Nutty, toasted malt, bready notes. Caramel. Strong flavored, bodied, no sign of abv. Pleasant.

Brown with off white head - Malt aroma with caramel - Malt body with caramel flavour and there is hints of bitterness in the back - The caramel flavour from the malt goes into the finish - This was good

500 ml bottle. Clear, dep amber with a medium sized, lacing tan head. Aroma is caramel malt, dry fruit and toast. Flavor is sweet, smooth dark malt, caramel, dry fruit, toast and hint of warming alcohol with moderate bitterness. Fine balanced body and fine aftertaste. All in a all a fine and well balanced bock, true the style and rather bold in flavor.

Bottle from Vinmonopolet Re. Dark brown body, with a red hue. Medium to big, almost white head. Very malty. Sweet, with some bitterness. Cough syrup, wort, herbs, red fruit, liquorice. Warming. Very thick and sticky body. Medium to soft carbonation. Good!

Bottle. The colour is clear brown with a beige head. Sweet and malty aroma of dried fruit, wort, wood and some cooked vegetables. The flavour is similar with coffee, caramel, wood and leather. Has a nice, silky and slick mouth feel, full-bodied and light bitterness. A malty and complex bock.

25.01.2017, 0,5l bottle @ home:
Nice slightly bubbly-creamy longlasting head. Aroma is slightly dry roasted, caramel malts, weeds, minerals, grass, roasted grain, nuts, "knekk", bark, toast, alcohol. Taste is slightly dry mineraly, toast, minerals, weeds, grass, nuts, caramel malts, "knekk", roasted grain, bark, alcohol. Medium bitterness, slightly dry and harsh mineraly mouthfeel. Fair enough.

Deep brown body with a beige head that is not that big, but its fully lasting and it laces the glass well. Sweet, malty and quite strong aroma that is dominated by caramel, also plenty of dark dried fruits. Some chocolate in the back, along with some surprising hoppy notes of pine. The strong flavour follows the aroma, with additional notes of alcohol and spices. Moderate sweet and moderate to light bitter taste. Mid-bodied, rather oily mouthfeel, and it actually dries up a bit in the finish. A nice dunkler buck that has more bitterness, less sweetness and more hops than a typical example of this style. 
[50 cl bottle, from Vinmonopolet Ullevål, Oslo]

Bottle. Pours deep amber with an off-white head. Aroma of malt, caramel, yeast and bread. Flavor is sweet and malty with some caramel, warming alcohol, licorice and yeast. Medium body, average carbonation.

Bottle. An almost clear one, brown in color and with a small, light beige head. Caramel, bread, some alcohol notes, fruityness and a touch of dried fruits in the aroma. Its full-bodied, lightly warming and pleasantly carbonated. Decent bitterness. The flavor is semi-sweet, with a light roasted touch. Caramel, bread and dried fruits too. Lasting finish. A decent beer indeed, but a bit alcoholic. 170107

Bottle 500ml @ gunnfryd
Pours hazy amber with a beige head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, chocolate, dried fruits and hint of alcohol. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with a long warm, caramel and dried fruity finish. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.
Flaske. Klar, mørk karamellfarget . Lavt karbonert med tynn skumtopp som forsvinner smaker karamell,krydder og har også et lite preg av tørket frukt. En fornøyelig juleøl

Flaske. Fint skum som varer lenge nedover. Aroma er malt, nøtter og krydder. Smaken er også malt, nøtter og krydder, men også tørkede frukter og litt sjokolade. Litt alkohol i smaken også dessverre. Det trekker litt ned og det spørs om ikke denne hadde vært bedre med 6-7 prosent i stedet for 8, men dette er uansett en god juleøl.

UPDATED: JAN 16, 2017 Shared bottle at DSJT at Cardinal 13.11.16 [7/4/7/4/14], with re-rate at Mi2 at Cardinal 16.01.17. Pale copper. Fine off-white head and lacing. Aroma of sweet malt, caramel and dark berries. Similar taste. Medium bitter aftertaste with burnt caramel and medium bitterness. A very competently made bockbeer. Well-balanced and refreshing! Carrots in aftertaste at first rating was gone in second tasting.

Big beige head. Clear deep dark red body. Fruity syrupy aroma with floral notes. Sweetish floral rosewater and strawberries taste with spicy notes. Mid-to-full body. Mild, soft mouthfeel. Sweetish earthy strawberry and fruit aftertaste with syrupy rye crisp bread notes. Lovely! So much flavour, such harmony, such complexity. Outstanding. (0.5l bottle, from wine monopoly, Strømmen.)

500ml bottle bought at Vinmonopolet Sentrum Tromsø. Pours a clear copper coloured body under a remaining beige head leaving crocheted lacing all over the glass. Hazy last pour. Inviting aroma of toffee and caramel. Mid-sweet flavours of caramel malts and chocolate supported by a backdrop of dried fruits, included figs. Mild roasted ending. Fine bodied and not overly sweet. Mostly hidden alcohol. A well made version of the style. I m glad I bought a few more bottles of this one for later enjoyment this Christmas (Shared with Ingebjørg, Tromsø 21.12.2016).

0.5l bottle, unfortunately no batch number on this. In th glass this one pours a deeper dark bronze colored body with a nice medium sized beigeish head - lots of nice dots and lacings on the glass. It smells mild. Was expecting a sour woody vinegar punch, but got absolutely none of that. Its more chocolaty, and almost a little sweet actually. Traces of blueberry, some dark malts and a mild pleasant malty sweetness. It has a mild oily texture in the mouth and its below average on the carbonation. Nice flavors. Traces of licorice and chocolate. A little roastiness also. Sweetish caramel. Its not metallic in any way this big plus. Yeah, this was a ice little surprise from Drammen. I was expecting a sour, got a well crafted lager. 17.12.2016

Bottle from Vinmonopolet, Kvadrat. Pours clear deep mahogany with a big creamy off-white head. Nice malty aroma, bread and toffee. Taste is nice malty, thick caramel and toffee, weak oily mouthfeel. Very good bock in my book ;-)

Lukt: Malt og krydder.
Utseende: Rødbrun.
Skum/kullsyre: Tynt skum.
Smak: Malt, frukter, sjokolade og krydder.
Hvor: Tasting kveld hos Untapd Geir med Bryne og Untapd Kristian.

Pours a deep clear bronze brown body with a small off-white head. Nose is caramel, grains, toffee and hints of dark fruits, banana and faint coca-cola. Taste is grains, caramel, toffee and hints of bread crust, chocolate, faint sulfur and brown bread. Medium body, medium to high carbonation. A fairly straightforward doppelbock on tje dry side of the spectrum; flawless but not overly impressive. Still, it is refreshing to see Haandbryggeriet make such a clean and classic beer style as this for the winter season.
Mahognifarget klar med høyt beige skum. Lukter brent karamell, kandis, trevirke og svisker. Fyldig søtlig noe brent karamell, lett bitterhet, noe kaffe, tørket frukt og alkohol. Middels lang.

Bottle. Pours slightly hazy, with a small, off white head. Aroma is roasted malts with bread and toffee. Medium body, with soft carbonation. Flavour is roasted malts, with burned sugar, leather and camphor.

Clear deep nutty color with a fine tan head. Looks good. Ok intensity in the aroma. Medium + body and a fine smooth carbonation level. A bit oily texture and a fine balanced sweetness. Nutty, toffee, herbal and dried fruits in the flavor. Nice tasty and balanced bock![Bottle at Havnelageret in Fredrikstad, Norway]

Fra flaske på DSJT, Cardinal nov-16: klar og dyp, rødlig ravfarge med ok skum. Maltdrevet aroma og smak med karamell, røde bær, samt litt tørkede frukter og noen urter. Balansert og god md fin munnfølelse. En svært lettdrikkelig bokkøl som må på innkjøpslista.

On bottle from vinmomopolet Stovner. Deep golden/brown color-good foam.medium aroma intensity ;malt, a little roasty, some honey , dried fruits and figue. Medium body & complexity. Some sweetness , balances great. Usually sceptical to Bocks, but this was very enjoiable

UPDATED: JAN 16, 2017 Bottle at home. Pours hazy copper with beige head. Aroma of caramel, dark bread, some alcohol, some notes of dried fruits. Tastes sweet with balancing bitterness, some umami. Bitter finish, medium bodied, smooth mouth feel.
